net.sf.click.extras.panel
Class TabbedPanel

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.click.extras.panel.BasicPanel
      net.sf.click.extras.panel.TabbedPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Control, Panel, Serializable
public class TabbedPanel
extends BasicPanel

Provides a way to add multiple sub-panels in 'tabs'. This panel comes with a default template that will render the panels in CSS customizable table tags. Additionally, a listener may be attached (similar to the control listeners) that will be called on tab switch. This could be useful to load (or reload) model related information for which ever panel is selected by the user. 

 <div id='$_tp_id'>
  <table class="tp_tab">
   <tr class="tp_tab">
    #foreach ($panel in $_tp_panels)
     #if ($panel.id == $_tp_activePanel.id)
      <td class="tp_tab_on">
       $panel.label
      </td>
      <td class="tp_tab_space"></td>
     #else
      <td class="tp_tab_off">
       <a href="$_tp_tabLink.getHref($panel.name)"
          id="$panel.id"
          class="tp_tab_link">$panel.label</a>
      </td>
      <td class="tp_tab_space"></td>
     #end
    #end
   </tr>
  </table>
  <table class="tp_content">
   <tr class="tp_content">
    <td class="tp_content">
     #parse($_tp_activePanel)
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
 </div>
As shown above, the the model context variables associated with a tabbed panel are as follows:
  • _tp_id   - the id associated with this tabbed panel
  • _tp_panels   - the sub-panels added to this panel
  • _tp_activePanel   - the currently active panel (aka tab)
  • _tp_tabLink   - an ActionLink control that handles the switching between the various panels.

Also, as show above, there are a number of CSS attributes that allow some customization of the output. These are as follows (these are the exact colors show in the example for tabbed panels): 

 table.tp_tab {
   border-collapse: collapse;
 }
 tr.tp_tab {
 }
 td.tp_tab_on {
   background: #336699;
   color: #ffffff;
   border-left: 1px solid #336699;
   border-top: 1px solid #336699;
   border-right: 1px solid #336699;
   padding: 5px;
 }
 td.tp_tab_off {
   background: #cccccc;
   color: #000000;
   border-left: 1px solid #336699;
   border-top: 1px solid #336699;
   border-right: 1px solid #336699;
   padding: 5px;
 }
 table.tp_content {
   border: 1px solid #336699;
 }
 tr.tp_content {
 }
 td.tp_content {
   background: #efefef;
 }

Author:
Phil Barnes

Method Detail

addPanel

public void addPanel(Panel panel)
NOTE: This method should not be called, in favor of addPanel(Panel, boolean), to ensure the "active" panel is defined. This method will by default set the active panel to the current panel being passed, to ensure that at least one active panel has been set.

Overrides:
addPanel in class BasicPanel
Parameters:
panel - the panel to add

addPanel

public void addPanel(Panel panel,
                     boolean isActivePanel)
Add's a "sub-panel" that will be rendered in a tab if the passed boolean is true. Otherwise, only the panel name and an associated link will be added. For all panels, an actionLink will be added that has a listener (handleTabSwitch) noted in this class that will handle the cycling through the various panels according to the clicked link.

Parameters:
panel -
isActivePanel -

setListener

public void setListener(Object listener,
                        String method)
Set the controls event listener. If the listener and method are non-null, then the listener will be called whenever a request to switch tabs is placed by clicking the link associated with that tab.

The method signature of the listener is:

  • must hava a valid Java method name
  • takes no arguments
  • returns a boolean value

An example event listener method would be: 

 public boolean onClick() {
     System.out.println("onClick called");
     return true;
 }

Specified by:
setListener in interface Control
Overrides:
setListener in class BasicPanel
Parameters:
listener - the listener object with the named method to invoke
method - the name of the method to invoke
See Also:
Control.setListener(Object, String)

setContext

public void setContext(Context context)
Specified by:
setContext in interface Control
Overrides:
setContext in class BasicPanel
See Also:
Control.setContext(Context)

handleTabSwitch

public boolean handleTabSwitch()
Handle the switching between tabs. This method will invoke the listener.method() as set by setListener(Object, String) if available, otherwise will just continue processing, therefore assume that all the information needed to "switch tabs" is already available to the model.

Returns:
true if processing should continue, false if it should halt

setActivePanel

protected void setActivePanel(Panel panel)
Removes the current 'active panel' from the model, and adds the passed panel as the new active panel.

Parameters:
panel -

toString

public String toString()
Overridden toString to add the path '/click/' to the beginning of the template name, as the template file will be copied to this directory upon first time start of ClickServlet

Overrides:
